llm_interpretation.plain_english_summary: Normal sinus rhythm with healthy electrical conduction throughout the heart.

regions.severity_explanation: All regions show normal electrical activity. No abnormalities detected.

llm_interpretation.patient_explanation: Great news! Your ECG shows a normal sinus rhythm at 72 beats per minute. This means your heart's electrical system is functioning exactly as it should. The SA node (your heart's natural pacemaker) is firing at a healthy rate, and the electrical signal is traveling normally through all parts of your heart. There are no signs of heart blocks, arrhythmias, or conduction delays. This is what a healthy heart rhythm looks like!
llm_interpretation.clinical_notes: ECG findings: Normal sinus rhythm. Rate: 72 BPM. PR interval: normal. QRS duration: normal. No ST-segment abnormalities. No evidence of bundle branch blocks, AV blocks, or atrial fibrillation. Assessment: Unremarkable ECG within normal limits.

visualization_suggestions.color_emphasis: All regions should be displayed in healthy green. Show smooth electrical activation wave from SA node through atria to ventricles.
